snippet: A muted White House reaction to the turmoil reflects both mixed feelings about President Mohamed Morsi’s ouster and Egypt’s shrinking role in American policy.
abstract: Muted White House reaction to the turmoil in Egypt reflects both mixed feelings about President Mohamed Morsi’s ouster and Egypt’s shrinking role in American policy; Obama administration has accepted the overthrow and is not seeking to restore Morsi, reasoning that in fact it could turn out for the best if the military quickly brings about new elections; main priority is minimizing violence and repression of dissent.
lead_paragraph: A muted White House reaction to the turmoil reflects both mixed feelings about President Mohamed Morsi’s ouster and Egypt’s shrinking role in American policy.

headline.main: Egypt Crisis Finds Washington Largely Ambivalent and Aloof
headline.print_headline: Egypt Crisis Finds Washington Largely Ambivalent and Aloof
